## Deleted Predicted value

-   $\hat{Y}_{i}$ is the predicted value of Y at X = $X_i$ using all the data except $(X_i,Y_i)$

## Leverage

-   $h_{ii}=\frac{1}{n}+\frac{(X_i-\bar{X})^2}{\Sigma(X_j-\bar{X})^2}$

:::notes
(Add notes)
:::

## Studentized residual

-   $Z_i=\frac{e_i}{\sqrt{(1-h_{ii})MSE}}$

:::notes
(Add notes)
:::

## Cook's distance

-   $D_i=\frac{\Sigma(\hat{Y}_j-\hat{Y}_{(j)})^2}{(k+1)\sqrt{MSE}}$
    -   where k is the number of independent variables
